description: four down! short of a good length, bit off extra bounce and zing  - Karthik leaves his bat hanging in the air to dry and the edge goes straight to Smith at second slip.
Slices to his demise. Full and outside the offstump and rather than crashing it through covers, Karthik ends up slicing his drive, in the air, to thirdman. Another one is down, four to go.

short of a good length delivery outside the off stump - bit of extra bounce there - Karthik looking to nudge it through the vacant slip area is done in by the extra bounce - ball slides off the face of the bat and goes straight to Boucher behind the stumps

gone! Bradshaw rolls the fingers over this one, landing it short of a length on leg stump and getting it to curl away, Karthik just stands there, attempting to run it fine, but the ball wins this battle and knocks back middle stump
Karthik goes! West Indies are back with a bang, Bravo bowls it in the channel outside off stump, Karthik fends at it and gets a faint nick through to Ramdin

the yorker gets him! Superb ball to follow the bouncer, it swings back into Karthik who tries to hit it on the leg side, he gets beaten and the ball hits the pad in front of middle and leg, was that missing leg? It looked close enough

well held, sir! And well bowled! Fernando drops a good lifter under Karthik's nose, and all he can do is hop and fend for himself, with bat out in front of body, and the leading edge is snapped up by Fernando himself, diving to his left

tossed up on middle and leg stump, the ball spins down as Karthik shuffles across and forward and plays with the turn, playing all over it, Rafique appeals...and thats a very surprising decision given that he was so far down the track, and that the ball bounced a bit too...ah well, thats the game of cricket for you
cleaned up! Karthik makes room and looks to drill this through the off side, but the balls not on for that shot, too full, and it hits the stumps
a there's the breakthrough, Haq has deserved that...Karthik flicks the ball in the air towards midwicket where McCallum takes a sharp catch, a nice moment for Scotland to enjoy
yorker gets Karthik. It was full, on the leg stump line and hit him low on the left leg. The hawk eye suggests it would have clipped the leg stump

And another one bites the dust. It's almost an action replay of the the Tendulkar dismissal. This time it's Stuart Broad with the short ball outside the off stump. Karthik sees it and gently, ever so gently, guides the ball to Alastair Cook in the off side. That is a soft dismissal if there ever was one, and Karthik fails to make use of the chance he has been afforded, being promoted to No. 3. England are in business here!
Karthik falls. Short and wide, Karthik goes for a cut shot but only ends up edging it to Prior. Clearly that Chak De movie is doing no good to these guys.

edged and gone! teasing length from Johnson - pitched up just outside the off stump. Karthik senses an opportunity to break the rut and get off the mark. he drives and the thinnest of edges goes through to Gilchrist
The paddle-scoop has done him in this time. He fetched it from outside off but only scooped it straight up for Ramdin to hold a simple catch. Bernard had taken pace off that ball
Gone!  Taylor gets him with a delivery that shaped away very late. The length drew Karthik forward before the ball tailed away to catch the outside edge. Superb delivery. Great to watch.
Got him! It landed on a length just outside off and moved in to hit him on the middle and leg line. It would have missed the leg stump but that's that. New Zealand taste some early success.
Thushara strikes. It was the short delivery at the rib cage, Karhik is late on the pull and gloves it down the leg side, well caught by Sangakkara. Enter Rahul Dravid.

good catch at mid-on by Dowlin! Karthik looks to keep going for the shots but flat-bats a length ball up over the bowler's head, it was miscued but looked like it may fall safe but Dowlin ran across to his left and plucked it with ease

falls short of a well deserved fifty! Good delivery by Thushara, pitches outside off on a fullish length and has karthik getting forward and across to angle it away, the thick outside edge is well taken by Sangakkara diving to his right

Appeal Karthik shapes to pull but the ball doesn't bounce as much, there was a sound and Mushfiqur took it inches off the ground, Taufel consults his colleague and they refer it to the third umpire, he confirms that it was indeed a clean catch, it took a while but the correct decision was made
gone! Surprised by the short ball, Karthik top-edges a hurried pull to Petersen at mid-on, easy catch off the splice of the bat and that's the third wicket down
the bowling change works, bowled it short on the off and Karthik, instinctively, went for the pull but didn't get hold of that one as well some of the previous ones, straight to Gibbs at midwicket
slower ball, well bowled, 127ks, and Karthik is early into the shot, and ends up hitting straight to Amla at mid-off. First breakthrough
India are wobbling here. Utseya bowls another floater outside off which goes on straight and Karthik decides to go for the cut but gets the edge. Taylor does well to hold on to it.

two-fingered googly, he read it too, rocked back to pull it, and instead of going over midwicket, he hit it straight into his lap. Soft dismissal, he is beside himself, did almost everything right, yet at the last moment the execution went wrong
Oh well .. DK is gone now .. He went for the reverse paddle and top edged a dolly of a catch to Taibu. It popped up gently and Taibu collected it. Thank you come again

legcutter does it, and Karthik has gone for a middling score after a good start once again. This legcutter is slow off the pitch and Karthik looks to play on the up again, the bat slices in his hand and he offers a simple return catch

whoa! Billy Bowden sets a record for a late decision, that would have made Steve Bucknor proud! Superb bowling from Herath, spin and bounce from middle, ripping across Karthik. Did it take the edge on the way to Sangakkara? Sri Lanka thought so, and around 10 seconds later, so did Billy who raised the crooked finger. Karthik goes in the 40s again.

Gentle full toss. Big swing of the bat. Out! Oh he has messed up there! It was a lollypop thrown around the leg stump line and Karthik went for the slog sweep and top edged it to deep square-leg. Good innings but it's over now.

Two in Two! Dinesh Karthik goes this time, it was an in-ducker from outside off and Karthik played down the wrong line as he played the forward defensive. He missed the ball and was struck flush on the pads in front of off. It looked plumb despite the fact that he was standing out of the crease. Replays suggest it would have carried over the stumps, with the bounce but well...

Caught at third man! It was shortish, it was well outside off and the shot was warranted. He went for the flaying cut shot but ended up slicing it straight to third man near the boundary. Out for a 35-ball 10. One man down.

Kula strikes again. Good planning, good catch, or is it a catch? Sanga has been standing up to stop Karthik from walking down and negating the swing. And after pinning him in the crease, Kula has been slipping in the straighter ones to beat him outside off. This time it is very close to off, and Sanga and Kula go for a big shout right away. There is no sound as the ball passes the bat, though. Nothing on the snicko either

That doesn't help him! Edge and gone! Another failure. It was a length delivery outside the off stump and DK has a lame poke at it. He fished out and got an edge. DK's time as opener (at least on tracks where the ball moves) has to come under immense scanner. Here, he seemed to shape for an on-the-up drive before just wafting softly at it. Just pushed weakly. Limply.

Karthik walks back disappointed, bowled it short just outside leg and he went after it, trying to work it down fine, there was a deviation and Sangakkara clasped it diving to his left, we're not sure if he gloved it but the umpire Rauf was certain, India suffer their first bowler
suddenly India are four down with more than ten overs to go, DK tried to dab a bouncer over the keeper, it was the slower one, cut in to the batsman, AB jumped to take the ball safely in one glove

slog swept, straight up in the air and Morgan takes the catch. It went up off a big top edge as Karthik went to sweep hard from off stump, Morgan came in a few yards from square leg and pouched the skier

Samuels breaks the partnership, soft dismissal, Karthik pushed at a tossed up ball, it spun in, took the inner part of the bat and popped back to the bowler, replays show bat brushed pad first before it came down on the ball
DK goes, charges out, it is a tossed up carrom ball, goes straight, DK slogs outside the line, misses, and Sanga does the rest

and a wicket with the first ball of the Powerplay. Dug in short, down the leg side, Ramdin collects after Karthik tries to pull. Ramdin hardly appeals, but Best does heartily, and it is given. Karthik is not happy, and it doesn't seem to have hit the glove. There is a clear case for show of dissent. Even Kohli looks very angry

lovely delivery. Karthik is stunned. Should have possibly played forward. Lots of revs and effort in this, pitches on a length, on middle and off. Karthik stays back in defence, the ball turns appreciably, beats the outside edge, and hits the off stump

that flies, that really flies but Mahela Jayawardene is standing in the way at slip and it ends up as catch No 201, DK tried to punch this off the back foot, it hurries on from a length, and the thick edge races to Mahela, he does well to hang on somehow

another carom ball and another wicket! This one pitched closer to the stumps, was still short, and DK went back to pull it but managed a leading edge for an easy catch to mid-off. Looks like he didn't pick it and played for the offspinner

he has lobbed it straight into the hands of short fine leg! Another premeditated sweep, but this time he gets a top edge and Ajmal tumbles to his right to pick up a good low catch. Needless stroke to a good length ball on off stump

another good, short ball. Another wicket. The shoulder-high bouncer outside off, and Karthik is late on it. The ball hits high on the bat, the outside half near the sticker, and loops up to the right of the keeper

taken at long leg! It's a top-edged hook - when Karthik played that shot once before, and he was beaten for pace. This time, he miscues it down the throat of Colin Munro. He does make a bit of a mess of it though, sliding to his left and nearly letting it pop out. Luckily, he is able to brace the ball against his chest. New Zealand were desperate for a breakthrough and Southee provides it

big lbw shout, and this time Anil Chaudhary raises his finger. Karthik's head falls over again, and he ends up playing outside the line, aiming a drive towards mid-on, as this length ball nips back into him. Consults for a long time with Iyer before deciding to review, and goes over the 15-second limit. Struck in line with middle stump, and ball-tracking says it's clipping the top of leg stump. Lakmal has worked him over brilliantly
